etymologies: late 19th century. From scientific Latin Myrcia, former genus name of the (Caribbean) bayberry, Pimenta racemosa (formerly P. acris) + -ene

definitions: A liquid terpene found in essential oils of bayberry, hop, and other plants, used in the manufacture of perfumes; 7-methyl-3-methylene-1,6-octadiene, CH₂:CHC(CH₂)CH₂ CH₂ CH:C(CH₃)₂.
